name: Cabot Lodge Jackson North

reviews.text: We are frequent travelers and come to Jackosn once a month. The Cabot North has always been our lodging of choice- it is consistently reasonably priced, conveniently located, well maintained and the other guests are business and family travelers.
reviews.title: Loud, Smoky and Dirty

likes.disliked: — entire faciltiy needs overhaul and the clientele is rapidly changing

reviews.text: However, the Cabot is rapidly changing. We were placed in hallway marked non-smoking, yet it felt like we were walking through a juke joint with the stench of stale smoke lingering in the hallway, each evening the halls were thick with marijuana smell and each evening, from about 11 p.m. until 3 a.m., drunk guests ran through the hallways, yelling, wrestling and slamming doors and hitting our doorway. We reported it three times to the front desk, yet each evening, the smoke and noise continued. While they were apologetic, nothing was done to change the situation.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are currently undergoing renovation, which is much needed. The rooms are dated, worn and felt sort of grimy. The amenities are very ppor quality, the sheets seemed threadbare and the housekeeping was haphazard at best.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

likes.liked: — clean, plenty of washcloths and towels, variety of breakfast choices

reviews.text: The entire facility felt well past its prime. It has sunk to the level of a Red Roof Inn, in maintenance and clientele. It is not worthy of the premium price you pay for the hotel. Stay at the Courtyard or Hilton across the street for the same price, but more consistency.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — The lobby size and decor - you can get out of the room and read, watch tv or visit

reviews.title: Love IT!
reviews.text: It is a shame that such a great hotel concept is being executed so poorly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel on the spur of the moment after reading the good reviews. I'm so glad we found it! It was such a great place!! Nice room. Comfortable bed. Took advantage of the free cocktails in the evening while watching Olympic curling on the flat screens in the HUGE (and beautiful) lobby. Breakfast was very good. Wish we could've stayed more than one night.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: This place was recommended by a friend and yes it is a pretty decent place. Not too expensive. Value for money. Staff is friendly. Rooms are pretty good. No glitz plain but roomy and clean. Lobby is nice and well maintained. Decent breakfast. Overall a nice place to stay in.
reviews.title: A quite nice place
Fabulous.
reviews.text: I found this hotel by chance while driving down the interstate. It was so lovely and comfortable, I stayed an extra day just to relax. Great hot breakfast, wonderful staff, great gym, elegant rooms, spotlessly clean, and quiet! The best roadside motel I have ever stayed in and I have stayed in quite a few! A stunning example of Southern Hospitality!
This hotel has the friendliest, most helpful staff of any hotel I've stayed. This includes desk clerks, house keeping, bartenders, and management. The accommodations were very nice as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff and Accomodations.

reviews.text: We travel to Jackson, MS, every March, and this was our first visit to the Cabot...but it won't be our last. We LOVED this hotel...it was beautiful, clean, comfortable and relaxing...and the service was awesome. There were seven ladies in our group this trip, and we all have only positive things to say about Cabot. We will DEFINITELY be back next year!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely PERFECT stay

reviews.text: Cabot Lodge, what a place! The staff is very friendly and attentive! Cocktails in the evening, Breakfast in the morning, who could ask for anything more! I loved my stay! Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Don't Even Think about it
reviews.text: This was the worst hotel I've ever visited!! The wall-paper in the bathroom was moldy, the tiles on the floor were broken, the room was so humid the bedspread felt wet, the ceiling had dark stains from obvious leaks, and the room smelled of urine and animals. PLEASE STAY AWAY if you like to breathe and want to get a good nights sleep.

I stopped over at this hotel on my vacation to Florida. It is an average hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff. The cocktails in the evening were nice and the donuts at the free breakfast were tasty. The lit trees in the lounge/dining area added a nice ambience. If you have to stay at a Cabot Lodge in Mississippi, stay at this one.
reviews.title: Better of the two Cabot Lodges in Mississippi

reviews.text: We have been frequent, and until now quite pleased, guests at the Cabot Lodge North and this stay was the most memorable! Our room was starting to show its age, was a non smoking room but had cigarette burns on the night stand and a broken microfridge unit and did not have the usual clean fresh feeling we have come to expect from our once beloved Cabot Lodge... it is a shame! The lobby area was also unkempt, with dirty tables even at 6 a.m.!!! Our car was also vandalized in the parking lot overnight and we received not even a simple apology from the management. Unfortunately, Cabot Lodge present is does nto hold a candle to the Cabot Lodge of yesterday....
reviews.title: Starting to slide... quickly downhilll!!!
A warm welcome awaits....
reviews.text: With its centrally located stone fireplace in a large, yet cozy lobby, the Cabot Lodge, North is a good place to stay for business or pleasure if your travel plans take you through Mississippi. The lobby (which overlooks pretty courtyards on either side) is comfortably funished and offers a generous buffet-style continental breakfast (love those chocolate chip muffins!), complimentary newspapers, and stragetically placed television sets (you can avoid them entirely by where you choose to sit.) In the evenings, the buffet is transformed into a complimentary cocktail bar, complete with popcorn. Twinkling white lights in the lobby trees and the fire (in season) are a welcome respite at the end of a busy day. Staff members are warm and friendly.

Traveled with a large group to Jackson, MS for a cheer competition. The comfort of the beds stands out first and foremost. I cannot say enough about how super comfy the beds and pillows were. I usually have a hard time being away from my own bed. The room altogether was great. Very clean with up to date decor and furnishings. The TV was a large flat panel screen. Free wireless internet to boot! I requested extra towels and was met with the utmost of kindness by the staff. Every evening they host a free "cocktail" hour from 5:30-7:30 with an open bar for grownups and popcorn and drinks for kids. The lobby is cozy with several couches and table and chair groupings with 4 huge TVs, one in each corner and a large open fireplace in the center. Since we were with a large group of girls we would all go down in our PJs and hang out together, and felt welcomed to do so. I absoluetly enjoyed myself. Also in the mornings they have a free full breakfast with fruit, waffle bar, cereal, eggs, bacon and sausage...all the basic breakfast stuff and like everything else the food was good.
reviews.title: Extra Comfortable!!!! Loved this place!

reviews.text: On a recent business trip, our conference members were set up at the Cabot Lodge in Ridgeland, MS. Being that this was going to be a week long trip, I hoped that my lodging would be at least comfortable. I was impressed all around with the Cabot. Upon my arrival there was no wait at check-in, the staff was friendly and offered me information about the hotel amenities. The hotel was recently remodeled and it shows!! The room was beautiful. It was furnished with a microwave and mini fridge, the bathroom was clean, and the "extras" were just an added plus. The bed was a bit hard for my taste but with hotels they are either too hard or too soft. The hotel offered a large breakfast in the morning which was wonderful: eggs, fruit, sausage, bacon, biscuits, waffles, muffins, 6 different juices and numerous choices in coffees. Also included was a cocktail hour that I didn't partake in but the others also staying for the conference had great reviews of. The facility had a 24 hour gym, courtyard pool, mini store, and access to our daily paper. The area that the Cabot is located in is a bit busy but not too much traffic that I couldn't handle. There is a mall right down the rode and tons of stores and businesses just down the street. I will definitely stay at the Cabot during my next trip to Jackson and would recommend it to anyone staying in the area.
reviews.title: Staying at the Cabot was like a home away from home

reviews.text: This is the second year in a row that 5 friends and I have stayed at the Cabot Lodge for the St. Paddy's Day parade and SPQ weekend. It has been just fabulous. Last year was great with friendly service, free evening coctails, free breakfast, clean facilities & right across from the Hilton and all for $89/night. So we booked again to be even more pleasantly surprised at renovated rooms. They were gorgeous. We loved the balconies overlooking the courtyard this time. As always, the staff was very friendly and personable, the evening drinks were very good, and the breakfast was filling. The breakfast is not as big as some continentals we've had (i,.e. no scrambled eggs, sausage, gravy, or waffles) but lots of pastries, breads, muffins, boiled eggs, cereals, sausage biscuits, fruit, juices, milk, hot chocolate, teas & coffees. And all for only $89/night again! We'll definately be back!!
reviews.title: Absolutely GREAT place to stay with friends!!

reviews.text: We stayed for one night for a business meeting in town. The hotel was easy to find, even in the dark and rain. The beds were very comfortable, the rain shower head was great. Even with the hotel being very busy, we found it to be quiet. Having a decent breakfast buffet was very helpful.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, helpful staff, convenient and decent breakfast

reviews.text: This hotel is great for couples or families. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are spacious and clean. The "continental" breakfast was bountiful and varied, and we loved the cocktail hour evenings to meet & greet other travelers! All in all, an excellent, relaxing time.
reviews.title: great place to stay

aka: Cabot Lodge Jackson North Hotel Ridgeland
description: Escape from the ordinary to Cabot Lodge - where hospitality comes naturally.
